Litecoin is 99% dominant in Scrypt PoW. LTC has network hashrate of 301 TH/s. The next largest non-merged-mined Scrypt coin (GAME) only has 2 TH/s. It's 99% dominant versus Bitcoin, which is only like 85% dominant because of BCH.
I'm talking about Litecoin not Bitcoin.
It's not likely, but it's possible if BTC becomes a huge threat. But all they can do is take down one coin and not all of cryptocurrency.
No, Litecoin and Bitcoin uses different POW algorithm.

Bitcoin Gold got 51% attacked. Miners have no issue with attacking BTG because if it dies, they could easily switch to mine another coin that also uses Equihash POW.
